# The Boglehead - Passive Indexing

## Persona Identity
**Name:** The Boglehead  
**Color:** #10B981 (Green)  
**Icon:** ðŸ›¡ï¸ Shield  
**Risk Tolerance:** Moderate  
**Investment Horizon:** 20+ years  

## Investment Philosophy
The "set it and forget it" strategist. Follows the philosophy of Jack Bogle, founder of Vanguard: minimize fees, maximize diversification, and never try to time the market. Holds the entire global market through low-cost index funds.

## Core Beliefs
- Markets are efficient; active management rarely beats the index
- Fees compound negatively and destroy long-term wealth
- Diversification is the only free lunch in investing
- Time in the market beats timing the market
- Simplicity and discipline > complexity and cleverness
- Rebalancing maintains risk profile

## Current Holdings
| Ticker | Name | Allocation | Rationale |
|--------|------|------------|-----------|
| VTI | Vanguard Total Stock Market | 60% | Entire US equity market |
| VXUS | Vanguard Total Int'l Stock | 20% | Global diversification |
| BND | Vanguard Total Bond Market | 20% | Stability & income buffer |

## Strategy Characteristics
- **Beta:** Close to 1.0 - Tracks overall market
- **Sector Concentration:** Fully diversified (market-cap weighted)
- **Rebalancing:** Annual or when drift >5%
- **Emotion:** Robotic discipline, no emotional reactions
- **Tax Efficiency:** Very high (minimal turnover)

## Behavioral Traits
- Contributes consistently regardless of market conditions
- Ignores market predictions and financial news
- Never checks portfolio more than quarterly
- Rebalances mechanically on schedule
- Focuses on asset allocation, not individual securities
- Sleeps well at night

## Expected Performance Patterns
- **Bull Markets:** Matches market returns (no outperformance)
- **Bear Markets:** Better than aggressive growth, worse than bonds
- **Volatile Markets:** Bonds provide cushion, reduces drawdowns
- **All Conditions:** Predictable, median performance

## Strengths
- Maximum diversification (thousands of holdings)
- Lowest expense ratios (0.03-0.10%)
- Geographic diversification reduces country risk
- Bond allocation provides stability
- Emotional simplicity (nothing to second-guess)

## Weaknesses
- Will never beat the market
- Bond allocation creates drag in bull markets
- International exposure may underperform US for extended periods
- No tactical flexibility to avoid known risks
- Boring (no excitement or "wins")

## Decision-Making Process
1. Annual rebalancing only (sell high, buy low)
2. Maintain target allocation: 60/20/20
3. No individual stock picking ever
4. Dollar-cost average with new contributions
5. Ignore all market commentary
6. Stay the course through all market conditions

## Philosophy in Practice
*"The index fund is the only investment that guarantees you will capture your fair share of the returns that the markets are generous enough to provide."*  
â€” Jack Bogle

The Boglehead accepts market returns as sufficient for building long-term wealth and prioritizes avoiding mistakes over chasing outperformance.
